nodes.bodyText: Can you explain the reason of this? (same question for fromObjectNode)
MongoDB converts the id attribute to _id as the primary key. This converts it back.
Changed to user MongoDB client. Thanks.
Just a very small side note that is not really related to this PR. Isnt't better to rename them setObjectCreatedListener since there can be just one listener?
I think the infinispan implementation supports multiple listeners, that's why it is named  addObjectCreatedListener.
Shouldn't return v instead of the oldvalue?
I think we want to use same Java Map semantic for put so it is correct to return previous value
Why two different ids?
Added a dummy _id here to avoid MongoDB converting the id attribute to _id to create primary key. I don't think it is necessary to create primary keys for the embedded documents.
@xiezhang7 wouldnt mongodb create the _id anyway and assign a primary key for that? If thats the case then we can simple resue the id attribute that we already provide.

MongoDB won't create the _id if there is a dummy one.
I have removed the _id and id will be converted to _id.
What is the reason for the changes of this class? Unused fields?
Too simplify the tests and avoid creating too many indexes.

nodes.bodyText: What is the reason of this sleep?
This is used to create desired timestamps for the tests. I have removed the sleep and explicitly specify the time interval instead.

The semantic of all these methods is getOrCreate so can you please use mongoDBStorageFactory.getOrCreateStorage also in these two methods?
Actually I think it could be nice to rename getCache methods to better explain the idea but let's do it in another PR because otherwise we will have a lot of code changes and review it will be harder
Please consider this and relative quarkus issue
I have changed all the tests that use the test resource to failsafe integration tests.

Is it possible to move this impl (or part of it) to common module?
I think it could be nice if we can limit code user has to write to use this library to the different implementations of AbstractStorage and then leverage on CDI to retrieve in a generic way all the components.
Wdyt?
Moved all the MongoDB Storage implementation to one class MongoStorage. Thanks.

What about move this fail statement just after ctx.registerProtoFiles(invalidFileDescriptorSource)? You can remove return fromcatch block in this case and I think it is a bit more readable.
Wdyt?
Moved. Thanks.
Because there is a default index on the primary key _id. There are only 63 left to be created.
could you use https://www.testcontainers.org/modules/databases/mongodb/ instead of a generic container?

nodes.bodyText: @xiezhang7 I guess the InfinispanCacheManager should not be initialized at all if not in use?
It is not initialized. But InfinispanCacheManager observes ShutdownEvent. So it will be created when quarkus terminates and fires ShutdownEvent.
Moved the observes method to another class, so that InfinispanCacheManager won't be initialized at all.
suggestion to use mongodb testcontainer instead.

nodes.bodyText: contains in here means an element in the array, perhaps look into using elemMatch ?
According to this mongodb tutorial, eq is used to query if the array field contains at least one element with the specified value.
Updated

We should be able to get changes done even from another runtime instance.

nodes.bodyText: @xiezhang7 shouldn't this be handled by the addObjectCreatedListener method so it only returns once subscription.request is called?
Moved to addObjectCreatedListener .
Could we simply reuse the same proto files for both tests?
The proto files for infinispan tests have more than 64 index annotations. Mongodb cannot create so many indexes.
@xiezhang7 shouldn't we reuse the MongoClient created by Quarkus instead? You should be able to retrieve that using injection.
Changed to use mongo client .
so it seems that we're creating multiple databases per type. Could we simplify that so there is only one database with multiple collections?
Changed to explicitly use one database .
@xiezhang7 should be enough to override this property using System.setProperty that way I think you can avoid creating the MongoConfigSource
Done. Removed MongoConfigSource .
maybe just comment out this, otherwise it can be quite verbose on Jenkins build.
